fko.chessly.player.computer.Omega

Class OmegaBoardPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • fko.chessly.player.computer.Omega.OmegaBoardPosition

  • public class OmegaBoardPosition
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Omega board and its position.
    It uses a x88 board, a stack for undo moves, zobrist keys for transposition tables, piece lists, material counter.
    Can be created with any FEN notation and also from GameBoards or as a copy from another OmegaBoardPosition.

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int move)
        Commits a move to the board. Due to performance there is no check if this move is legal on the current board. Legal check needs to be done beforehand. Usually the move will be generated by our MoveGenerator and therefore the move will be assumed legal anyway.
        Parameters:
        move - the move

      • undoMove

        public void undoMove()
        Takes back the last move from the board

      • makeNullMove

        public void makeNullMove()
        Makes a null move. Essentially switches sides within same position.

      • undoNullMove

        public void undoNullMove()
        Undo a null move. Essentially switches back sides within same position.

      • isAttacked

        public boolean isAttacked(OmegaColor attackerColor,
                          OmegaSquare kingPosition)
        This checks if a certain square is currently under attack by the player of the given color. It does not matter who has the next move on this position. It also is not checking if the actual attack can be done as a legal move. E.g. a pinned piece could not actually make a capture on the square.
        Parameters:
        attackerColor -
        kingPosition -
        Returns:
        true if under attack

      • hasCheck

        public boolean hasCheck()
        Returns:
        true if current position has check for next player

      • hasCheckMate

        public boolean hasCheckMate()
        Tests for mate on this position. If true the next player has lost. Expensive test as all legal moves have to be generated.
        Returns:
        true if current position is mate for next player

      • check50Moves

        public boolean check50Moves()
        The fifty-move rule – if during the previous 50 moves no pawn has been moved and no capture has been made, either player may claim a draw.
        Returns:
        true if during the previous 50 moves no pawn has been moved and no capture has been made

      • check3Repetitions

        public boolean check3Repetitions()
        Threefold repetition of a position – this most commonly occurs when neither side is able to avoid repeating moves without incurring a disadvantage. The three occurrences of the position need not occur on consecutive moves for a claim to be valid. FIDE rules make no mention of perpetual check; this is merely a specific type of draw by threefold repetition.
        Returns:
        true if this position has been played three times

      • checkInsufficientMaterial

        public boolean checkInsufficientMaterial()
        FIDE Draws - Evaluation might define some more draw values.
        Returns:
        true if neither side can win

      • getZobristKey

        public long getZobristKey()
        Returns:
        the zobristKey

        public int getLastMove()
        Returns the last move. Returns OmegaMove.NOMOVE if there is no last move.
        Returns:
        int representing a move
